properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 7 at 2:30PM EST until January 8 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
* WHAT...West winds 15 to 25 mph expected, with a few gusts around
45 to 50 mph possible.

* WHERE...Portions of the foothills and upper French Broad River
valley in western North Carolina.

* WHEN...From 6 AM to 6 PM EST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest surge of winds will occur
from sunrise to early afternoon on Wednesday, mainly across the
area along and immediately east of the Blue Ridge Escarpment.
The winds are expected to subside gradually on Wednesday
afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM EST WEDNESDAY
